item.title: AEFIS Acquired by HelioCampus, Branding and Minor Adjustments Coming to User Interface
item.description: In the fall of 2021, the higher-education analytics company HelioCampus acquired AEFIS, which is an assessment management platform used here at Rensselaer. Since then, the AEFIS team has grown and the tool has expanded its offerings, and as a result, Rensselaer will soon see a branding change from AEFIS to HelioCampus, in addition to some minor user interface and main menu updates.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Researchers Find New Potential Drug Target for Alzheimer’s Disease
item.description: Chunya Wang, Ph.D., professor of biological sciences at Rensselaer, has added to his body of research on Alzheimer’s disease with significant findings in Angewandte Chemie. Together with his team, Wang performed the most comprehensive study to date of the interactions between the protein Apolipoprotein E and heparan sulfate, and their findings point to a new potential drug target to slow the progress of Alzheimer’s disease.

item.title: Troy Redevelopment Foundation Funds Community Projects
item.description: Thanks to the Troy Redevelopment Foundation, a variety of projects that benefit the community are underway or completed. Established in 1995, the Foundation is a voluntary consortium of not-for-profit institutions in the City of Troy, including Emma Willard, St. Peter’s Health Partners, Russell Sage College, and Rensselaer.

item.title: Campus Card Office Issues Reminder Regarding Guest Card Renewals
item.description: Rensselaer’s Campus Card Office wishes to remind all campus departments that the Card Office must complete all 2023/24 guest card renewals – such as those for on- and off-campus vendors and contractors, and visiting researchers – by Friday, June 30, 2023. Anyone who needs to renew a guest card for the coming fiscal year should use the appropriate webformto submit their request by Thursday, June 15 to ensure timely processing and completion.

item.title: Info Session to Highlight Analytics, Machine Learning, AI
item.description: Date: Tuesday, June 6, 2023 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for a 30-minute information session highlighting Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning, and AI. Attendees can expect to learn how data can inform better decisions, and will review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand. Please registerif you plan to attend.
